extends DimpleOptionHolder
implements INode, java.lang.Cloneable

        @Nullable
protected java.lang.String _label

      • _flags

        protected int _flags
        Temporary flags that can be used to mark the node during the execution of various algorithms or to mark non-static attributes of the node.

        The flags are automatically cleared by initialize().

      • notifyListenerChanged

        public void notifyListenerChanged()
        Description copied from interface: IDimpleEventSource
        Notify the source that it should refresh its event setting.

        This can be used when the event listener settings affecting this object have changed dynamically and you want the changes to take effect earlier than would be the case automatically. For instance, objects that can generate high-frequency events may normally refresh their settings during the initialization phase.

        Specified by:
        notifyListenerChanged in interface IDimpleEventSource

      • getAncestors

        public java.util.List<FactorGraph> getAncestors()

      • getAncestorAtHeight

        @Nullable
public FactorGraph getAncestorAtHeight(int height)
        Description copied from interface: INode
        Returns the ancestor of this node at the specified height, where height zero refers to the immediate parent of the node returned by INode.hasParentGraph(). Returns null if height is greater than the distance between this node and the root graph.

        When this returns a non-null value, then the following should be true: 

            n.getDepthBelowAncestor(n.getAncestorAtHeight(h)) == h
        Specified by:
        getAncestorAtHeight in interface INode
        See Also:
        INode.getDepthBelowAncestor(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.core.FactorGraph)

      • getCommonAncestor

        @Nullable
public FactorGraph getCommonAncestor(Node other,
                                     @Nullable
                                     java.util.List<FactorGraph> uncommonAncestors)
        Returns the closest common ancestor graph containing both this node and other or null if there isn't one.
        Parameters:
        other - is another node with which to compare.
        uncommonAncestors - if non-null, then any ancestors that are not in common will be added to this list in order from top to bottom.
        See Also:
        getCommonAncestor(Node)

      • getCommonAncestor

        @Nullable
public FactorGraph getCommonAncestor(Node other)
        Returns the closest common ancestor graph containing both this node and other or null if there isn't one.
        See Also:
        getCommonAncestor(Node, List)

        public java.util.List<? extends INode> getSiblings()
        Description copied from interface: INode

        Specified by:

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()

        Returns the node's depth below the root FactorGraph, the number of graphs visited when walking through the chain of INode.getParentGraph()s.
        Specified by:

      • getDepthBelowAncestor

        public int getDepthBelowAncestor(FactorGraph ancestor)
        Description copied from interface: INode
        Returns the depth of the node relative to the given ancestor. It is the number of graphs between the node and the ancestor graph when walking through the chain of INode.getParentGraph(). Returns 0 if ancestor is parent of this node. Returns the negative depth minus one if ancestor is not an ancestor of this node.

        When this returns a non-negative value, then the following should be true: 

           n.getAncestorAtHeight(n.getDepthBelowAncestor(g)) == g
        Specified by:
        getDepthBelowAncestor in interface INode
        See Also:
        INode.getAncestorAtHeight(int)

      • getConnectedNodesFlat

        public com.analog.lyric.util.misc.IMapList<INode> getConnectedNodesFlat()
        Specified by:

      • connect

        public void connect(INode node)
        Description copied from interface: INode
        Adds node as a sibling of this node.

        Note that this does not perform the converse operation so to connect two nodes to each other you need to invoke this on each of them: 

            node1.connect(node2);
    node2.connect(node1);
        Specified by:
        connect in interface INode

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(int portNum)
        Description copied from interface: INode
        Removes sibling node with given index from list of siblings.

        Note that as with INode.connect(INode), this does not perform the converse operation.

        Specified by:
        disconnect in interface INode
        See Also:
        INode.disconnect(INode)

      • clearFlags

        protected void clearFlags()
        Clear all flag values. Invoked automatically by initialize().

      • clearFlags

        protected void clearFlags(int mask)
        Clear flags in given mask.

        Subclasses should not use bits in the RESERVED mask.

      • clearSiblings

        protected void clearSiblings()

      • getEventMask

        protected int getEventMask()
        Return mask of flag bits that are used to determine whether to generate events. This is used by notifyListenerChanged() to clear the specified flag bits. It is assumed that the value of all zeros indicates that the object needs to recompute its flags based on the listener.

        The default implementation returns zero.

        Since:
        0.06

      • isFlagSet

        protected boolean isFlagSet(int mask)
        True if all of the bits in mask are set in the flags.

        Subclasses should not use bits in the RESERVED mask.

      • notifyConnectionsChanged

        protected void notifyConnectionsChanged()
        Invoked when a change is made to the siblings list. Subclasses may override this to clear cached state that was computed from the siblings. The default implementation does nothing.
        Since:
        0.07

      • raiseEvent

        protected final void raiseEvent(@Nullable
              DimpleEvent event)

      • replaceSibling

        protected void replaceSibling(INode oldNode,
                  INode newNode)

      • setFlags

        protected final void setFlags(int mask)
        Sets all of the bits in mask in the flags.

        Subclasses should not use bits in the RESERVED mask.

      • setFlagValue

        @Internal
protected final void setFlagValue(int mask,
                         int value)
        Sets bits of flag specified by mask to value.
